conclusion: Given data: mass of ball M, mass of bullet m, height of table h, horizontal distance s, acceleration due to gravity g.
Expression for time taken by ball to fall from table: t = sqrt(2h/g).
Substitute given values into time expression: t = sqrt(2h/g).
Expression for horizontal distance: s = v_x * t.
Substitute given values into horizontal distance expression: s = v_x * sqrt(2h/g).
Solve for horizontal velocity v_x: v_x = s / sqrt(2h/g).
Expression for conservation of momentum: Mv_x = mv.
Substitute given values into momentum expression: M(s / sqrt(2h/g)) = mv.
Solve for bullet velocity v: v = Ms / (m * sqrt(2h/g)).
Final answer: velocity of bullet is Ms / (m * sqrt(2h/g)).
